get.description: **Gets the baseline values for a resource**.

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: The identifier of the resource. It has the following structure: subscriptions/{subscriptionName}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{providerName}/{resourceName}. For example: subscriptions/b368ca2f-e298-46b7-b0ab-012281956afa/resourceGroups/vms/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1

parameters.name: metricnames
parameters.description: The names of the metrics (comma separated) to retrieve.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: The aggregation type of the metric to retrieve the baseline for.

parameters.name: sensitivities
parameters.description: The list of sensitivities (comma separated) to retrieve.

parameters.name: resultType
parameters.description: Allows retrieving only metadata of the baseline. On data request all information is retrieved.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: metricnamespace
parameters.description: Metric namespace to query metric definitions for.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The **$filter** is used to describe a set of dimensions with their concrete values which produce a specific metric's time series, in which a baseline is requested for.

200.description: Successful request to get the list of metric values.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: **Gets the baseline values for a specific metric**.

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: The identifier of the resource. It has the following structure: subscriptions/{subscriptionName}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{providerName}/{resourceName}. For example: subscriptions/b368ca2f-e298-46b7-b0ab-012281956afa/resourceGroups/vms/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.description: The name of the metric to retrieve the baseline for.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: The aggregation type of the metric to retrieve the baseline for.

parameters.name: sensitivities
parameters.description: The list of sensitivities (comma separated) to retrieve.

parameters.name: resultType
parameters.description: Allows retrieving only metadata of the baseline. On data request all information is retrieved.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: metricnamespace
parameters.description: Metric namespace to query metric definitions for.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The **$filter** is used to describe a set of dimensions with their concrete values which produce a specific metric's time series, in which a baseline is requested for.

200.description: Successful request to get the list of metric values.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

highThresholds.description: The high thresholds of the baseline.

lowThresholds.description: The low thresholds of the baseline.

Baseline.description: The baseline values for a single sensitivity value.

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric.

baseline.description: The baseline values for each sensitivity.

interval.description: The interval (window size) for which the metric data was returned in.  This may be adjusted in the future and returned back from what was originally requested.  This is not present if a metadata request was made.

timespan.description: The timespan for which the data was retrieved. Its value consists of two datetimes concatenated, separated by '/'.  This may be adjusted in the future and returned back from what was originally requested.

timestamps.description: The array of timestamps of the baselines.

items.description: The timestamp for the baseline value in ISO 8601 format.

type.description: The resource type of the baseline resource.

BaselineResponse.description: The response to a baseline query.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

ErrorResponse.description: Describes the format of Error response.

AggregationParameter.name: aggregation
AggregationParameter.description: The aggregation type of the metric to retrieve the baseline for.

BaselineResultTypeParameter.name: resultType
BaselineResultTypeParameter.description: Allows retrieving only metadata of the baseline. On data request all information is retrieved.

ExtendedResourceUriParameter.name: resourceUri
ExtendedResourceUriParameter.description: The identifier of the resource. It has the following structure: subscriptions/{subscriptionName}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{providerName}/{resourceName}. For example: subscriptions/b368ca2f-e298-46b7-b0ab-012281956afa/resourceGroups/vms/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1

IntervalParameter.name: interval
IntervalParameter.description: The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query.

MetricNameParameter.name: metricName
MetricNameParameter.description: The name of the metric to retrieve the baseline for.

MetricNamesParameter.name: metricnames
MetricNamesParameter.description: The names of the metrics (comma separated) to retrieve.

MetricNamespaceParameter.name: metricnamespace
MetricNamespaceParameter.description: Metric namespace to query metric definitions for.

SensitivitiesParameter.name: sensitivities
SensitivitiesParameter.description: The list of sensitivities (comma separated) to retrieve.

TimespanParameter.name: timespan
TimespanParameter.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.
